intro: Graphephorum wolfii, commonly known as the wolf's bane, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Graphephorum wolfii is often found in rocky or dry soils, thriving in full sun to partial shade. It is also known for its toxic properties, containing compounds that can be harmful to humans and animals.
